Take this course to become a Certified Kubernetes Administrator. Enroll today!

courseDescription:
Kubernetes provides an open-source system that automates the deployment and scaling of containerized applications across multiple hosts. It manages the lifecycle of containerized apps by providing service automation, storage orchestration, deployment management, and many other features. This course aims to equip infotech professionals with an arsenal of technical skills in Kubernetes. It covers cluster architecture, installation and configuration, workloads and scheduling, and every other Certified Kubernetes Administrator (CKA) examination domain.

Herein, you will learn about the components, architecture, and installation options for Kubernetes. Likewise, the core services of Kubernetes, including clusters and nodes, objects, and the application programming interface (API), will be discussed. Learn how to make API requests, search for an API, and then access the API from the command line interface. In addition, the course addresses crucial topics like storage configurations, deployments, networking and security, and monitoring and troubleshooting Kubernetes.

The last section presents practice questions to aid your preparation for the CKA exam. This course was designed by Joseph Holbrook, a Google Cloud Engineer, Blockchain Solutions Architect, and author of several books with over 25 years of experience in the information technology (IT) industry. Take this course to acquire advanced technical skills to boost your career opportunities as a Certified Kubernetes Administrator. Start today!
